author: Staff Reporter
text:
All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam cadre offering sweet to the portrait of party general secretary and Chief MinisterJayalalithaa in front of the Coimbatore Combined Court Building on the occasion of her birthday on Wednesday.—Photo: M. Periasamy

All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) workers and members of affiliated organisations like Amma Peravai and Ilaignar Pasarai celebrated the party general secretary and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s 68{+t}{+h}birthday on Wednesday by cutting cakes, gifting just-born infants and providing food to children and aged in homes.

According to sources, Urban District Secretary P.R.G. Arun Kumar led the celebrations in the city by cutting a 68 kg. cake and participating in special prayers organised in temples, mosques and churches. He also led his party workers in offering food to children at children’s homes and the elderly at senior citizens homes.

The party men donated gold rings to infants born on the day at the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital. On Tuesday, the party men had donated a cow to the Siddhapudur Ayyappan Temple.

The Coimbatore rural unit also organised special prayers at temples. There was a special prayer, coconut breaking ceremony and temple car pulling ceremony at Eachanari and Marudhamalai temples. The party unit had also organised a blood donation campaign that saw 78 persons donate blood. Party men in Mettupalayam, Pollachi and other parts of the district also organised various events to celebrate the Chief Minister’s birthday.
title: AIADMK workers celebrate Jayalalithaa’s birthday
